intro: Lithospermum mirabile, commonly known as the marvelous rock pepper, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces striking violet to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its roots contain compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Lithospermum mirabile is often found growing in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
